channel.title: Java.net.unknownhostexception issue
channel.description:
I'm in the process of making a RSPS, but am fairly new and am having a few hiccups along the way. Here's one I've run into and cannot seem to find a solution. I was hoping someone could help me resolve this issue. When I click, "play now" under the client files of my rsps, it comes up with the following:
connecting to update server java.net.UnknownHostException: renegadepkz3.no-ip.org at java.net.Int6AddressImp1.lookup11HostAddr<Native Method> at java.net.IntAddress$1.lokupAllHostAddr<Unknown Source> at java.net.InterAddress.getAddressesFromNameService<Uknown Source> at java.net.InterAddress.getAllByName0<Unknown Source> at java.net.InterAddress.getAllByName<Unknown Source> at java.net.InterAddress.getAllByName<Unknown Source> at java.net.InterAddress.getByName<Unknown Source> at Gui.<init><Gui.java:50> at Gui.main<Gui.java:35>
Now, this message only appears for a split second and closes out. But, if anyone knows what I can do to fix this, I'd be most grateful. :)

item.title: Java.net.unknownhostexception issue
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

It can’t connect to the IP. Is your no-ip correct, you could’ve perhaps made a mistake?

Read full topic

item.title: Java.net.unknownhostexception issue
item.dc:creator: @Lip_Tag Lip Tag
item.description:
@Lip_Tag wrote:

I’m in the process of making a RSPS, but am fairly new and am having a few hiccups along the way. Here’s one I’ve run into and cannot seem to find a solution. I was hoping someone could help me resolve this issue. When I click, “play now” under the client files of my rsps, it comes up with the following:

connecting to update server
java.net.UnknownHostException: renegadepkz3.no-ip.org
at java.net.Int6AddressImp1.lookup11HostAddr
at java.net.IntAddress$1.lokupAllHostAddr
at java.net.InterAddress.getAddressesFromNameService
at java.net.InterAddress.getAllByName0
at java.net.InterAddress.getAllByName
at java.net.InterAddress.getAllByName
at java.net.InterAddress.getByName
at Gui.Gui.java:50
at Gui.mainGui.java:35

Now, this message only appears for a split second and closes out. But, if anyone knows what I can do to fix this, I’d be most grateful.

Read full topic
